EventsDetail.Name: Horseback Riding
EventsDetail.Title: Horseback Riding
EventsDetail.BodyCopy:
Join us as we explore southeast idaho by horseback. From beginner to advanced trips, Idaho has a lot to offer. All trips meet at the ORC (located under the North end of the stadium) and tickets can be purchased from the Kimball ticket office or online.

HFP Trail Rides
Great News! We are now offering 5 different time spots for Saturday trail rides.
This is the best ride for beginners to come and learn the basics of horseback riding while enjoying the outdoors.  The casual 1 hour ride from the Livestock Center to the banks of the Teton River are nice to enjoy this time of year. Since there are so many students who would like the chance to attend this activity, we ask that you only sign up for 1 HFP trail ride a year.

Dates Offered: November 10 and 17
Departure Time: 9:30 a.m. , 11 a.m. , 12:30 p.m. , 2 p.m. , or 3:30 p.m.
Return Time: 2 hours after
Cost: $12

Meet at: ORC (under the North end of the stadium)

 

Harriman Horseback Ride

Harriman State Park is located just 50 miles North of Rexburg. The 2 hour horseback rides there have been some of the favorites and often wildlife can be seen during this ride. These trips are for intermediate to advanced riders.  Trips are limited, so we ask that students only attend 1 Harriman horseback trip while attending BYU-Idaho.

Date: October 12 and 20
Departure Time: 4 p.m.
Return Time: 9 p.m. (estimate)
Cost: $30

Meet at: ORC (under the North end of the stadium)

xPower.Name: Semesters
xPower.label: Available Semesters
xPower.AdditionalInformation:
Gear List:

Long pants and closed toe shoes are mandatory
Long sleeve shirts help prevent sunburns and mosquitos
Snacks
Waterbottle
Hat
Sunglasses

Jackets for cool days

We hope to see you on the next trip with the Outdoor Activities Department. Please remember that only students or spouse of students can participate.

Please meet at the Outdoor Resource Center with your I-card at least 15 minutes before departure time.

Purchase your ticket at the ticket office in the Kimball or online at http://www.byui.edu/tickets/
